headline: BREAKTHROUGH: First PURSUE verdict in 10 cycles — Customer Support Vacuum advances. All 3 overdue research questions resolved. Triple cross-domain convergence confirms thesis.

recent_signals.headline: ENGINE DIRECTIVE: Customer Support meets ALL advancement criteria — first PURSUE in 10 cycles
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: 10 cycles of rigorous filtering across 22 evaluated opportunities. Customer Support Vacuum is the first to pass every test: service layer density <$500M, market-priced confirmation (staffing -51%), precedent failure validation (Klarna), unit economics (30-40% margin), founder fit, vertical beachhead (SaaS mid-market), LATAM competitive moat.

recent_signals.headline: RESOLVED: Customer support SERVICE layer density <$500M — SPARSE (tool layer $5B+ is distinct market)
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Three-layer competitive analysis: Tool layer ($5B+ saturated), BPO layer ($20B+ human-first), AI-first managed service layer (<$500M sparse). No company at scale specifically operates AI-first + human escalation as fully managed service.

recent_signals.headline: Staffing canary persists: RHI -51%, MAN -39%, KELYA -20% — no recovery signal, structural thesis reinforced
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Market-priced confirmation of professional labor structural decline. No recovery after multiple quarters strengthens structural interpretation. 6-12 month leading indicator hypothesis on track for Q2-Q3 2026 BLS/JOLTS validation.

recent_signals.headline: CROSS-DOMAIN: Beveridge + equity + timing arbitrage TRIPLE convergence on Customer Support — strongest cross-signal ever
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Three independently-derived analytical lenses all point to Customer Support Vacuum: Beveridge structural mismatch, staffing canary equity collapse, P7 timing arbitrage failures. This is the strongest cross-signal reinforcement in engine history.

recent_signals.headline: RESOLVED: Mars Petcare acquisition-led not software-building, IDEXX diagnostics-focused not practice ops — vet window open
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Mars strategy is ownership + CPG products, not practice software. IDEXX strategy is diagnostics AI (hematology, pathology), not workflow operations. Neither building practice-level operations AI. Archy ($47M) is lone modern entrant. Risk: Mars acquires Archy (15-25% probability within 24 months).

recent_signals.headline: Unit economics validated: AI-first hybrid support at $8/hr blended vs BPO $20/hr — 60% cost advantage, 30-40% gross margin
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: AI handles 65% of tickets at ~$0.50/ticket. LATAM human agents handle 35% at $8-12/hr. Break-even at 5-8 clients ($75K-$120K MRR). Startup capital ($500K-$1M) funds 12-18 months to profitability.

recent_signals.headline: RESOLVED: Wholesale trade brokerage distinct from freight (K-004) on 4/6 dimensions — K-004 does not apply
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Formal distinction memo: no logistics coordination, no dominant incumbent, minimal regulation, commission-based (no credit extension). Freight kill pattern does NOT automatically apply. Key remaining risk: relationship stickiness varies by commodity vertical.

recent_signals.headline: BPO structural inversion barrier: 300K+ workforces, headcount contracts, human-first DNA — cannot flip to AI-first within 12-24 months
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Classic innovator's dilemma. BPO firms are adding AI to existing human-first model (10-30% savings). AI-first model delivers 60-67% savings. BPO cannot invert without destroying existing business, workforce, and contracts.

recent_signals.headline: IO Table first application: Customer support land-and-expand → sales ops → account mgmt → client success ($10-15B → $40-60B TAM)
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: First real application of IO table propagation methodology. Disruption propagates from customer support (now) to adjacent customer-facing functions (6-24 months). Same platform, same clients, expanding scope. TAM expansion 4x.

recent_signals.headline: COUNTER: Sierra AI ($200M+, $4.5B val, Bret Taylor) could pivot from enterprise tool to managed mid-market service
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Counter-signal: Sierra AI positioned as enterprise AI agent platform. If pivots to managed service for mid-market, density increases significantly. Currently enterprise/tool focus leaves mid-market open. Monitor quarterly.

recent_signals.headline: LATAM talent reframed as competitive moat: Argentina agents $8-12/hr vs US $20-35/hr in human escalation layer
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Standalone LATAM opportunity parked. LATAM talent pipeline reframed as competitive advantage within Customer Support: 60% cost advantage in human escalation layer. Founder advantage: Argentina citizen with recruiting networks.

recent_signals.headline: NEW INSIGHT: Hidden density — incumbent AI adoption is the competitive threat, not startup formation
recent_signals.systemic_pattern: Business applications flat despite P3=100. But density IS forming through incumbents adding AI (Concentrix, TTEC, Accenture $3B). Engine needs to add 'incumbent AI adoption rate' as density metric alongside startup funding.

opportunity_rankings.name: Customer Support Vacuum Filler — Managed Hybrid Human+AI
opportunity_rankings.key_insight: First PURSUE in 10 cycles. Service layer density <$500M resolved. Triple cross-domain convergence. Unit economics 30-40% margin. SaaS mid-market beachhead. LATAM agent moat.

opportunity_rankings.name: Veterinary Services — Agentic Practice Operations
opportunity_rankings.key_insight: Mars/IDEXX threat resolved — neither building practice ops AI. Sparsest competitive density in pipeline (<$100M). Next: customer discovery with vet practice owners.

opportunity_rankings.name: Wholesale Trade AI Broker — NAICS 425120
opportunity_rankings.key_insight: K-004 freight distinction memo convincing on 4/6 dimensions. Commodity chemicals vertical identified. Next: broker interviews and Knowde competitive assessment.

cycle_summary.key_achievement: First PURSUE verdict in 10 cycles. Engine transitions from pure analysis to execution support.
